moves.1. d4: In this game we can study the importance of a strong tactical game.
moves.4. e3 O-O 5. Bd3 d5 6. Nf3 Ne4: Strange move here for Black. It was better to develop the other pieces.
moves.7. Qc2 Bxc3+ 8. bxc3 f5 9. O-O Bd7 10. B: An attempt to place the Rook in position for an attack.
moves.11. cxd5 exd5: Here white has all the pieces developed, but black has a well placed Knight.
moves.12. c4: White tries to get rid of the weak back pawn.
moves.12... c6: Another bad move in my opinion. Better was Be6 and later develop the Knight to c6
moves.13. Qb3: Now Black is starting to feel the pressure and is beeing punished for not developing faster.
moves.13... Be8: Black tries to leave a place todevelop the Knight. At this point I saw a wonderful tactical blow.
moves.15. Be7: 15. Be7 ! a superb blow right in the middle of Black defence. A Black Rook is gone.
moves.15... Qxe7 16. Qxa8 g5: 16... g3? Black tries to counter but at the same time weakens even further the position of its King. Here I had a number of options. I decided not to take the advancing pawn because it could pose a threat to my King since lines would open to the remaining Black Rook. That couls be dangerous for my King and Black still had a well placed Knight.
moves.17. cxd5: So I went for the center where I was stronger.
moves.17... Nb6 18. Qb8 g4 19. Bxe4 fxe4 20. N: Now White has a well placed Knight.
moves.20... cxd5 21. Rac1: Now is a matter of bringing the remaining forces.
moves.21... Nc4 22. Nxc4 dxc4 23. Rxc4: Black resigned. Rc7 would follow and with the King in bad position it would be an easy win. Hope you learned something with this game.
